item.title: A “Wife Swap” Family’s Unimaginable Tragedy
item.description: The Stockdale family, once featured on Wife Swap for their strict household rules, faced an unthinkable tragedy years later. This case reveals how control and fear led to devastating consequences.

media:content.media:title: A “Wife Swap” Family’s Unimaginable Tragedy
media:content.media:description: The Stockdale family, once featured on Wife Swap for their strict household rules, faced an unthinkable tragedy years later. This case reveals how control and fear led to devastating consequences.

item.title: Changing Confessions Lead To A Huge Break! Zoe Campos
item.description: In 2022, a confession by Carlos Rodriguez brought a major turning point in the case of 18-year-old Zoe Campos who vanished in Texas in 2013. Investigators tied Rodriguez to her death and the discovery of her remains after he altered his story multiple times, sparking renewed scrutiny of the long-running missing person investigation.

item.title: Dee Dee & Gypsy Blanchard: A Wild Truth Uncovered
item.description: Gypsy Blanchard grew up believing she was gravely ill—until the truth unraveled. The lies told by her mother, Dee Dee, led to one of the most shocking and heartbreaking cases in true crime.

item.title: What Netflix Left Out of “Unknown Number”
item.description: In 2018, siblings Danielle Marzejka, 18, and Seren Bryan, 19, were found murdered in a shed behind their family home in Clinton Township, Michigan. The killer, Danielle’s boyfriend Ousmane Diallo, had shot both victims before hiding their bodies in plastic bags. Diallo fled but was soon arrested and later sentenced to life in prison without parole. The tragedy left a community reeling and a family shattered. How can love and trust so easily turn into betrayal and violence?

item.title: How Mark Winger Almost Got Away With Murder
item.description: When Donnah Winger was found murdered, her husband Mark claimed he was protecting her. Years later, evidence revealed a calculated plan — and a chilling cover story that nearly worked.

item.title: Held for 8 Months: The Eduardo Valseca Story
item.description: Businessman Eduardo Valseca was kidnapped in Mexico and held in a small box for eight months. His resilience and will to survive shocked investigators and inspired global attention.

item.title: Sarah Turney Speaks After Her Father’s Acquittal
item.description: Sarah Turney opens up about her sister Alissa’s case after their father, Michael Turney, was acquitted of her murder. She also discusses media exploitation and how it shaped her view of true crime.

item.title: What Actually Happened To Shawn O'Brien?
item.description: Shawn O’Brien was found unconscious in his Rhodes Island apartment in July 2006 with a severe head injury and died days later. While the official cause of death was ruled “blunt force trauma to the head” with the manner of death listed as undetermined, his family argues the evidence points to homicide—yet no charges have ever been filed.

item.title: Non-Human Biologics Recovered?!
item.description: Former U.S. intelligence officer David Grusch testified before Congress in 2023, asserting that the U.S. government possesses non-human biological remains recovered from UFO crash sites. Journalist Ross Coulthart has reported on these claims, interviewing whistleblowers who allege involvement in retrieval programs. Both have faced skepticism, with official agencies denying such programs exist.

item.title: A happy ending. Victims FOUND after 10 years
item.description: Amanda Berry, Gina DeJesus, and Michelle Knight were rescued in Cleveland in 2013 after being held captive by Ariel Castro for 9–11 years. Their escape brought national attention, led to Castro’s arrest, and reunited the women with their families.

item.title: What Happened To Dallas Mom Prisma Reyes?
item.description: Prisma Denisse Peralta Reyes, a 26-year-old mom from Mesquite, Texas, disappeared on April 17, 2019, after missing her shift and failing to pick up her 6-year-old son from a babysitter. She was last seen on surveillance video in Dallas outside an apartment complex where her ex-boyfriend lived. Her white Jeep was found abandoned there. The case remains unsolved, with no suspects identified, despite multiple tips, released footage, and the family’s efforts to spread awareness.

item.title: The True Story of Anna Delvey’s Deception
item.description: Anna Delvey posed as a wealthy heiress, scamming New York’s elite out of thousands. Her story of deception and ambition inspired global fascination and the hit Netflix series Inventing Anna.

item.title: The Disappearance on Murder Mountain
item.description: Garret Rodriguez went to California’s Humboldt County to work on a cannabis farm but never returned. His death exposed the dark underbelly of “Murder Mountain” and the dangers hidden there.

item.title: Did She Plot To Get Rid Of Her Husband?
item.description: In 2023, beauty queen Lindsay Shiver, her lover Terrance Bethel, and an alleged associate were charged in the Bahamas with a murder-for-hire plot targeting her estranged husband, Robert Shiver. Authorities say text messages and photos showing Lindsay sent orders to “kill him” sparked the conspiracy case. Bethel and Shiver plead not guilty, claiming it was all just venting.

item.title: Hollywood Actor Reincarnated in a 10-Year-Old Boy?
item.description: Ryan Hammond, a 10-year-old from Oklahoma, insists he is the reincarnation of Marty Martyn, a Hollywood actor and agent who died in 1964. His vivid memories include meeting Marilyn Monroe and working in the film industry. Experts, including child psychiatrist Dr. Jim Tucker, have found his recollections remarkably accurate.

item.title: What Was In Those Trash Bags?
item.description: In May 2019, Jennifer Dulos vanished after dropping her children at school. Surveillance footage showed her estranged husband, Fotis Dulos, and his girlfriend, Michelle Troconis, discarding trash bags in Hartford. Inside were items stained with Jennifer's blood, ponchos, zip ties, gloves, and clothing—linking them to her disappearance. Fotis died by suicide in 2020; Troconis was convicted in 2024 for conspiracy to commit murder and evidence tampering. Jennifer was declared legally dead in 2023, but her body remains missing.

item.title: Chief Grant Hardin Betrayed the Oath to Protect and Serve
item.description: Grant Hardin, a former police chief, briefly escaped from prison in 2025 before being recaptured, raising concerns about prison security and oversight.

item.title: Travis Walton’s Unbelievable UFO Story
item.description: In 1975, logger Travis Walton claimed he was taken by a UFO in Arizona. He disappeared for five days before returning, sparking decades of debate over what really happened that night.

item.title: What Happened to Flight 980?
item.description: In 1985, Eastern Airlines Flight 980 crashed into the Andes Mountains, killing all 29 people on board. Decades later, mystery surrounds the wreckage and what really caused the disaster.

item.title: Anatoly Moskvin: The Man With 26 Dolls
item.description: Russian historian Anatoly Moskvin was found living with 26 preserved bodies dressed as dolls. His case shocked investigators and raised chilling questions about obsession and morality.
